decks.notes: This Dimir Control deck focuses on utilizing powerful control cards like Force of Will and Force of Negation to disrupt the opponent's plays while gaining card advantage with cards like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time. It also includes efficient removal like Fatal Push and countermagic like Spell Pierce to control the board and protect its own threats. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional value by recurring cheap permanents. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent through a combination of disruption and card advantage.

This deck focuses on generating a large amount of card advantage and mana through cards like Paradoxical Outcome and Moxen. The goal is to draw into key combo pieces quickly and efficiently, using counterspells and removal to protect the combo. By utilizing card draw and mana acceleration, this deck aims to set up explosive turns where it can win the game in a single, powerful combo. The companion Lurrus of the Dream-Den adds an additional element of recursion and flexibility to the deck.

The deck revolves around utilizing the graveyard as a resource to quickly assemble a combo that overwhelms the opponent. By constantly milling cards and utilizing cards like Noxious Revival and Creeping Chill, the deck can quickly get key pieces into the graveyard and onto the battlefield. This deck aims to maximize its graveyard interactions with cards like Golgari Grave-Troll and Ichorid while also disrupting the opponent with counterspells like Force of Will and Force of Negation. The main win condition is to create a board state with Prized Amalgam and other creatures to quickly close out the game.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of countering spells, powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier, and disruptive cards like Oath of Druids. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up its own win condition, typically through cheating out powerful creatures with Show and Tell or Flash. The deck also utilizes powerful tutors like Demonic Tutor and Vampiric Tutor to find key cards quickly. Overall, the strategy revolves around controlling the board and setting up game-winning plays with efficient and powerful cards.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy while also generating card advantage. By utilizing counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce, along with targeted removal like Fatal Push, the deck aims to control the board and prevent the opponent from executing their game plan. The inclusion of cards like Ancestral Recall, Dig Through Time, and Treasure Cruise allows the deck to efficiently draw through the deck and find key pieces to secure the win. Additionally, the deck utilizes powerful artifacts like Black Lotus and Null Rod to further disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The main concept of this Dimir Control deck is to stall the opponent with counterspells and removal cards while using card draw and filtering to find key threats like Murktide Regent. By combining disruption with powerful finishers and resource denial, the deck aims to control the game's pace and dictate the flow of the match. It also includes a mix of high-impact spells and efficient answers to handle a variety of different strategies, ensuring that the deck can adapt to different matchups and come out on top through careful decision-making and strategic play.

This deck focuses on setting up a powerful combo using Doomsday to manipulate the top of the deck and win the game with Thassa's Oracle or Unable to Scream. The deck includes powerful card draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Brainstorm, as well as disruption spells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo. It also includes mana acceleration with Black Lotus and Moxen, as well as fetch lands to ensure the right colors of mana. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces quickly and efficiently to win the game before the opponent can stop you.

The main idea of this deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan by using hate cards like Archon of Emeria, Void Mirror, and Chalice of the Void, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Anointed Peacekeeper and Seasoned Dungeoneer. By combining disruptive elements with a fast clock, this aggro-hatebear deck aims to control the board and prevent the opponent from executing their strategy effectively, ultimately leading to victory through a combination of disruption and aggression.

This MUD aggro deck focuses on disrupting opponent's strategies while utilizing artifact mana acceleration to quickly deploy threats and overwhelm the opposition. Cards like Mishra's Workshop and  Ancient Tomb provide additional mana to cast powerful artifact creatures like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Lodestone Golem, while cards like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere slow down the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes various hate cards like Null Rod and Thorn of Amethyst to further disrupt the opponent's strategy. By efficiently using artifact synergies and disruptive elements, this deck aims to overpower the opponent and secure victory.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using cards like Force of Will and Fatal Push to disrupt the opponent's strategy. It also utilizes card advantage with Ancestral Recall and Treasure Cruise, while having a strong mana base with Underground Sea and Wasteland. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds another layer of versatility to the deck. Overall, the key concept of this Dimir Control deck is to outmaneuver and outlast the opponent through a combination of disruption, card advantage, and efficient threats.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures with disruptive abilities, such as Anointed Peacekeeper and Archon of Emeria, while also using hate cards like Void Mirror to disrupt opponents' strategies. It aims to control the game through hatebears and prevent the opponent from executing their game plan effectively. The deck also includes mana accelerants like Moxen and Lotus cards to play its threats ahead of schedule, enabling a fast and disruptive aggressive strategy in Vintage 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on utilizing Paradoxical Outcome to return multiple artifacts to hand and draw cards, generating mana and storm count to eventually win the game through a combo finish. It aims to assemble a critical mass of artifacts and spells to overwhelm the opponent quickly, with cards like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value by recurring key pieces from the graveyard.

The focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, disruption, and powerful spells like Ancestral Recall and Show and Tell. The key strategy revolves around using Oath of Druids to cheat powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier into play early, while also utilizing cards like Thoughtseize and Gitaxian Probe to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of cards like Boseiju, Who Endures and Flash provide additional flexibility and resilience to the control strategy, allowing for a variety of ways to outmaneuver and outplay the opponent.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize the Dredge mechanic to quickly fill the graveyard with cards such as Prized Amalgam, Narcomoeba, and Stinkweed Imp. By constantly dredging cards from the graveyard, the deck is able to generate advantage and deploy threats such as Hollow One and Silversmote Ghoul at a rapid pace. Additionally, the deck includes disruption elements like Force of Will and Force of Negation to protect its game plan. The combination of graveyard synergy and disruptive elements makes this Combo-Dredge deck a formidable force in a Vintage 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan with hatebears like Archon of Emeria and Chancellor of the Annex, while also deploying aggressive creatures like Clarion Conqueror and White Plume Adventurer to put pressure on the opponent. It utilizes powerful mana acceleration sources like Black Lotus and Moxen to quickly deploy threats and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Void Mirror and Wasteland to further impede the opponent's plans. The goal is to establish control of the game early and maintain pressure to secure a win.

The deck focuses on creating a fast and aggressive board presence using artifacts, with an emphasis on overwhelming the opponent quickly. It utilizes powerful mana acceleration cards like Black Lotus and Ancient Tomb to play threats like Glaring Fleshraker and Scrawling Crawler ahead of schedule. Key cards like Mystic Forge and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain provide card advantage and added power to the artifacts in play. The deck aims to establish early dominance and disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere, while using cards like Manifold Key and The One Ring to push through for the win.
